column4: Sorry to keep spamming, but does anyone know how to mess around with display settings in Ubuntu?
so its /etc/X11/xorg.conf i made a type

you need to check for TV out settings for your card, you can probably google them, and then try them, but ALLWAYS backup your original xorg.conf first, so you can replace it using the CLI, the graphics wont work with wrong xorg settings :)
make a backup and make sure you can replace and copy files using the CLI (a terminal)
so if it goes wrong you can put the backup back
if it goes wrong ubuntu will boot into CLI (command line interface)
still even then you can pop in the live cd and use it to replace your xorg with the backup or your original one
but that will only take longer
but look for a good TV out tutorial to read so you have a good idea what you're up against
live cd will work too if youre unsure with CLI
(by that i mean the way you probably installed ubuntu)
cant help you with the settings though, never had a ATI myself
you just need to read the guide he gave you several times
